title: What are the differences between intradisciplinary, interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary? - Quora

response.answer_text: To answer this we essentially adopt the explanation given by Stember’s “Advancing Social Sciences” Intradisciplinary : Working within one single discipline say mathematics,statistics,corrporate finance Crossdisciplinary;Looking or evaluating one discipline from the perspective of another Multidisciplinary: Involves a set of people from several separate disciplines working together ,with each exploiting his/her own domain knowledge Interdisciplinary: Involves an integration of knowledge and techniques/methods sourced from different disciplines with a synthesis of approaches. Transdisciplinary unity of intellectual schools of thought far ahead of the disciplinary perspectives. It is quite important to take into account the inherent friction between the disciplines and that makes distinguishing disciplines both simple and immeasurably tough!(Check Refsum Jensenius blog)! Disciplinarities: intra, cross, multi, inter, trans

we will start with understanding following terms, which can be frequently seen in research paper, university brochure, curriculum or pedagogy introduction etc. Intradisciplinary: working within a single discipline.e.g. Bachelor in computer science.Crossdisciplinary: viewing one discipline from the perspective of another.e.g. Computer Concepts from the perspective of Mathematics theorem.Multidisciplinary: people from different disciplines working together, each drawing on their disciplinary knowledge.e.g. Any big project with multiple aspect.Interdisciplinary: integrating knowledge and methods from different disciplines, using a real synthesis of approaches.e.g. Study of population using ICT.Transdisciplinary: creating an unity of intellectual frameworks beyond the disciplinary perspectives.e.g. integrating Population study outcome with the computer graphics to obtain the real time analysis.In terms of corelation between different field: 1 < 2 < 3 < 4 < 5 (ascending order)
